name: asciidoc.vim
description:
*Update:* A more sophisticated syntax file for Asciidoc is included since release 8.2. Check http://www.methods.co.nz/asciidoc/ f or details.

This is a syntax file for Asciidoc markup. You'll get info about Asciidoc on the Asciidoc Homepage: http://www.methods.co.nz/asciidoc/.

currently the following elements are supported:

 * titles
 * rules
 * bullets
 * TODO, FIXME, ToDo, FixMe
 * references
 * labels
 * footnotes
 * links
 * comments
 * meta info

Thanks to Dag for several enhancements!

Feel free to submit patches, comments, suggestions...to felix at obenhuber dot de and don't forget to cc asciidoc-discuss at metaperl dot com.
install_details:
copy the file to $VIMRUNTIME/syntax

...and :help syn-files is your friend!
